title: A History of Australian art. Part 2 (MAC & PC)
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Interactive media
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Multimedia systems
description: Episode of Series "History of Australian art". This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1920-1970. From Margaraet Preston to Brett Whitely, controversial modernist art, and the influence of American styles such as Abstract Expressionism. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC, 2MB RAM, 1MB free disc space, 8 bit colour card, system 6.0.5 or higher, CD ROM XA. IBM PC and Compatible; Windows 3.1 or higher, 4MB RAM, 4MB free disk space, VGA display, MPC Compatible CD ROM XA.
related_objects: Series; S01353; History of Australian art; Active; 1986
